intro: Caliphruria korsakoffii, commonly known as the Korsakoff's caliphruria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and high temperatures. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying succulent plant adaptations.
